column4: im on ubuntu hardy and I just installed LAMP, apache works but when i open a php file it downloads it
when i opened httpd.conf it's empty
Did you follow everything on this page? https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ApacheMySQLPHP
Ubuntu doesn't use httpd.conf
Did you follow everything on that page?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ApacheMySQLPHP
add them to the admin group
does 'groups' show you're in the admin group?
Whats the username?
And you're currently on a user that can sudo, yes?
well, I'll ignore the "don't use root" lecture, usermod -G admin -a joshua
then "groups joshua" and you'll see admin
what does "groups joshua" return?
Have you edited your sudoers file?
no.
Oh, have you been logged in with joshua this whole time?  try logging out/ and logging back in
pastebin the output of "groups joshua" and "cat /etc/sudoers"
it won't be.  this is what your sudoers should look like: http://paste.ubuntu.com/32168/
yeah... those are important
visudo, always use visudo
i dunno how to use vi I used nano
works now :D
visudo honors EDITOR, in your .bashrc put "export EDITOR=nano" and visudo will use nano
